{"step_by_step_thinking": "First, we need to consider the age of the child and the fact that there is no pain. This suggests that the carious lesions have not reached the pulp of the teeth. Indirect pulp capping is a procedure used to encourage the pulp to heal itself and is often used in cases where the decay is near the pulp but has not reached it. Pulpotomy and RCT are more invasive procedures and are typically used when the decay has reached the pulp or there is an infection. Extraction is the last resort when the tooth cannot be saved. Given the child's age and the absence of pain, it would be best to start with the least invasive procedure.", "answer_choice": "A"}
